body: Can you still reproduce this problem? It's possible it's a firewall issue, Windows has lots of difficulty with local networking when firewalls, such as sophos are running.
I tried it again and I found out it works generally but it doesn't work with my portable python ( http://portablepython.com/ ).

Can a single execute run?

``` python
rc[0].apply_sync(lambda : 1)
```

What about execute?

``` python
rc[0]..execute("a=5", block=True)
```

Can you include the output of `ipcontroller --debug` when running these tests?

This is the output before I run your commands:


Running: 
    rc[0].apply_sync(lambda : 1)

does not return a result (it hangs).
There's no further output in the IPControllerApp except further heartbeats.

Same with
   rc[0].execute("a=5", block=True)

If there's no further output, the client messages aren't even arriving at the scheduler. I can't think of how this could be accomplished other than firewall issues or misconfiguration. What are the contents of your connection files?

I've disabled the windows firewall, but the issue still remains. No other firewall is running on the computer.
Also everything is working if I'm not using portable python. So I would rule out a misconfiguration of ipython, since both use the same config files in my user dir.

Which connection  files do you mean? I'm guessing:
.ipython\profile_default\security\ipcontroller-client.json:
`{
  "control": 64471, 
  "task": 64477, 
  "notification": 64481, 
  "task_scheme": "leastload", 
  "mux": 64473, 
  "iopub": 64479, 
  "ssh": "", 
  "key": "d44ee4dc-00db-4493-a185-3f5b0b0d7f15", 
  "registration": 64467, 
  "interface": "tcp://172.30.31.69", 
  "signature_scheme": "hmac-sha256", 
  "pack": "json", 
  "unpack": "json", 
  "location": "172.30.31.69"
}`

ipcontroller-engine.json
`{
  "control": 64472, 
  "task": 64478, 
  "hb_ping": 64475, 
  "mux": 64474, 
  "pack": "json", 
  "hb_pong": 64476, 
  "ssh": "", 
  "key": "d44ee4dc-00db-4493-a185-3f5b0b0d7f15", 
  "registration": 64467, 
  "interface": "tcp://172.30.31.69", 
  "iopub": 64480, 
  "signature_scheme": "hmac-sha256", 
  "unpack": "json", 
  "location": "172.30.31.69"
}`

If you have Windows you can test my portable python installation:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/367262/Python27portable.zip
( this needs to go to c:\irisCluster\Python27Portable )

Thanks for your help!
Okay, if you can rule out misconfiguration and firewalls, then it seems like it's a problem with Portable Python itself, presumably in the pyzmq package.
